data.title: Good Food and Friendly Staff!
data.text: Stopped here for lunch after a visit to the museum. They were very accommodating to families and the food was very good! The staff was great and very helpful!

data.title: Wedding Reception
data.text: Leonardos catered the meal for the wedding reception and the food was great. Fast service and many attended and all were very pleased.

data.title: Okay for a bite to eat while at the museum.
data.text: I've been here to eat a few times when visiting the museum with my kids.  If you order a sandwich you get just that, a sandwich.  If you would like a drink or chips it is all ordered separately.  They do have a small salad bar, soups, and daily specials.

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: I went there on a lunch break while working downtown on St. Paty's day. I had never tried it before and wanted somthing new. The daily special was a peanut butter sauce wrap. I have never tried anything like that before. I loved it. It came with my choice from the salad bar or a bowl of soup, I chose salad. For under $7 I thought it was a great lunch and it more than filled me up. I would recomend them for a quick bite, and a far better one than most fast food joints for the same price or less.

data.title: Excellent Pre-Show Dining
data.text:
Although we have attended several shows at the Washington Pavilion, this is the first time we have eaten at the onsite restaurant - Leonardo's Café.
It was Valentine's weekend so we had reservations.  The buffet was fresh and inviting to the eye. Included were some selections geared to the show - The Million Dollar Quartet. For instance we had Johnny Cash's Chili and Carl Perkin's Shrimp. 
The dessert buffet featured Elvis Presley's peanut butter and banana mouse and my favorite - cheesecake filled strawberries. 
The made-to-order pasta station was very well organized and delicious. I would go back just to eat the pasta!
With the higher priced items on the buffet, we felt the price was reasonable at $18.95 which included a soft drink or coffee.  
We always seem to arrive too early for shows so this was a nice way to spend that time. We will certainly return.

data.title: Ok
data.text: The prices were right so I thought we would eat here.  I was hoping for a healthy meal that was close to the Pavilion without having fast greasy food.  The food was healthy and kids have their usual options - PB&J and others.  It was a great place to grab a quick bite to eat.  The only thing that bothered me a little was the Leonardo Da Vinci Vitruvian Man with his genitalia right there.  I understand it is art, but I have two little kids who sat staring at his genitalia while we were eating.

data.title: A fun little cafe!
data.text: They've got great hot dogs!!!!!  They've got other things too but I love their hot dogs!  Great for children's birthday parties too!

data.title: Love the soup and salad bar and their daily specials
data.text: The Cafe is located in the Washington Pavilion. For downtown folks it's a place you can walk to, get in and out over the lunch hour and always has seating. When I worked downtown I ate there about every other week. The cook makes great soups and will have an unusual one to try along with a standard.  The salad bar items are in small containers so the food is kept fresh and cold.  They have daily specials for around $7 (main dish, a side and a drink).  If you are there with small children they do have food the kids gravitate to - hot dogs, pizza, etc.

data.title: Fresh food at a great price.
data.text: The prices here are perfect for a budget  friendly lunch.  I especially appreciate the 1/2 sandwich plus cup of soup option.  The food is flavorful and fresh, but the staff could be more friendly and engaging. My coworker had one of the Flatbread options which looked delicious. My buffalo meatloaf sandwich was very good, as well. We will be back.

data.title: Fast, light lunch.
data.text: I'm a frequent visitor and love their flatbreads.  Decently priced, great for light work lunches.  My only qualm is that you take care of your own tray and dirty  dishes at a station when finished, but they really need to have a hand sanitizer there, or something to clean your hands with.

data.title: Holy moly this place has terrible food
data.text: I didnt think you could mess up a chili dog but what I got was some taco meat on a stale bun with a cold dog. That wasnt even the worst thing we got. The "sausage soup" tasted like what consisted of leftover italian pizza sausage mixed in with melted velveeta. Sooooo gross.

user_location.name: Sioux Falls, South Dakota, United States
